Description: Scarab probably carved from steatite; back crudely made and simply detailed, with head roughly marked, prothorax and elytra indicated by deeply incised single line; at side, legs simply marked by hastily made incisions; flat underside blank; surface with greenish tinge; part of left side broken and chipped in a number of places.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Birmingham City Museum and Art Gallery. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The lack of design on the underside can indicate an unfinished scarab or a simple amulet in the shape of a scarab. Alternatively, the motif was maybe completely worn out.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.91) (phase 3)
